issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Implement renewal / cancellation of Delegation Tokens

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Equivalent of YARN-50 for JobHistory tokens.

comments.body: Work in progress. More details on YARN-50.

I think the comment on YARN-50 regarding the need for HS conf settings on the RM would only be required if HS tokens are assumed to be for the local cluster instead of connecting to the address contained in the service field.
Updated patch.
I think it looks ok.  I'd like to see the {{YARNRunner}} changes to throw exception for renew/cancel on a separate jira so this change only makes renew work, and doesn't change other behavior.
Oh, and {{CancelDelegationTokenResponseProto(proto)}} appears to be missing viaProto = true.

Cancelling the MR side of the patch .... doesn't really make sense to cancel JobHistory tokens when the job completes, since that's exactly when they're required. 

Couple of options for the short term. 
1) we could have the RM renew tokens but not cancel them. This still has MR classpath dependency.
2) have the history server issue tokens for a longer period, same as the max-age.
The second option seems better.

I'm not sure if there is a problem canceling JH tokens when the task completes.  Tokens are intended to take the place of kerberos auth within a task.  The token allows the oozie launcher or pig's controlling task to poll for its sub-job statuses.  The external process that launched the job had kerberos auth to submit the job, so it will have kerberos auth to query the JH server.
Discussion on how to remove cited problem of MR jars needing to be in RM's CLASSPATH.

A launcher which submits jobs using delegation tokens (since it doesn't have kerberos credentials) may need to pull job details after the job completes. That would require the history server delegation tokens. I believe the Oozie launcher works like this for certain Oozie action types.

bq. I'm not sure if there is a problem canceling JH tokens when the task completes
You're right. Scratch my last two comments. Uploading a patch for branch 23.
Patch for branch-0.23
branch-0.23 patch with unit test.
trunk patch. Requires YARN-50
branch-23 patch.
trunk patch.
+1 looks good.  Note that jenkins +1'd this on the combined patch put up in YARN-50. Thanks Sidd!
